pimgMIB.name: pimgMIB

revisions.description: Initial version, published as RFC xxxx (to be filled in by RFC-Editor).

pimgMIB.contactinfo: Dave Thaler Microsoft Corporation One Microsoft Way Redmond, WA 98052-6399 US Phone: +1 425 703 8835 EMail: dthaler@dthaler.microsoft.com Andrew Adams Merit Network, Inc. 4251 Plymouth Rd. Ann Arbor, MI 48105-2785 Phone: +1 734 763-6378 EMail: ala@merit.edu William Siadak Merit Network, Inc. 4251 Plymouth Rd. Ann Arbor, MI 48105-2785 Phone: +1 734 936 2035 EMail: wfs@merit.edu
pimgMIB.description: The MIB module for management of PIM routers.

pimgJoinPruneInterval.name: pimgJoinPruneInterval
pimgJoinPruneInterval.description: The default interval at which periodic PIM-SM Join/Prune messages are to be sent.

pimgInterfaceTable.name: pimgInterfaceTable
pimgInterfaceTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the router's PIM interfaces. IGMP and PIM are enabled on all interfaces listed in this table.

pimgInterfaceEntry.name: pimgInterfaceEntry
pimgInterfaceEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimgInterfaceTable.

pimgInterfaceIfIndex.name: pimgInterfaceIfIndex
pimgInterfaceIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value of this PIM interface.

pimgInterfaceAddressType.name: pimgInterfaceAddressType
pimgInterfaceAddressType.description: A value indicating the address family of the address contained in pimgInterfaceAddress. Legal values correspond to the subset of address families for which PIM routing is supported.

pimgInterfaceAddress.name: pimgInterfaceAddress
pimgInterfaceAddress.description: The IP address of the PIM interface.

pimgInterfaceNetMaskLen.name: pimgInterfaceNetMaskLen
pimgInterfaceNetMaskLen.description: The length in bits of the network mask which when combined with the corresponding value of pimgInterfaceAddress identifies the address of the network to which the PIM interface is attached.

pimgInterfaceMode.name: pimgInterfaceMode
pimgInterfaceMode.description: The configured mode of this PIM interface. A value of sparseDense is only valid for PIMv1.

pimgInterfaceDRType.name: pimgInterfaceDRType
pimgInterfaceDRType.description: A value indicating the address family of the address contained in pimgInterfaceDR. The value MUST be the same as the value of pimgInterfaceAddressType.

pimgInterfaceDR.name: pimgInterfaceDR
pimgInterfaceDR.description: The Designated Router on this PIM interface. For point-to-point interfaces, pimgInterfaceDR will be 0.0.0.0 in the case of an IPv4 entry, and 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:0 in the case of an IPv6 entry.

pimgInterfaceHelloInterval.name: pimgInterfaceHelloInterval
pimgInterfaceHelloInterval.description: The frequency at which PIM Hello messages are transmitted on this interface.

pimgInterfaceStatus.name: pimgInterfaceStatus
pimgInterfaceStatus.description: The status of this entry. Creating the entry enables PIM on the interface; destroying the entry disables PIM on the interface.

pimgInterfaceJoinPruneInterval.name: pimgInterfaceJoinPruneInterval
pimgInterfaceJoinPruneInterval.description: The frequency at which PIM Join/Prune messages are transmitted on this PIM interface. The default value of this object is the pimgJoinPruneInterval.

pimgInterfaceCBSRPreference.name: pimgInterfaceCBSRPreference
pimgInterfaceCBSRPreference.description: The preference value for the local interface as a candidate bootstrap router. The value of -1 is used to indicate that the local interface is not a candidate BSR interface.

pimgNeighborTable.name: pimgNeighborTable
pimgNeighborTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the router's PIM neighbors.

pimgNeighborEntry.name: pimgNeighborEntry
pimgNeighborEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimgNeighborTable.

pimgNeighborAddressType.name: pimgNeighborAddressType
pimgNeighborAddressType.description: A value indicating the address family of the address contained in pimgNeighborAddress. Legal values correspond to the subset of address families for which PIM routing is supported.

pimgNeighborAddress.name: pimgNeighborAddress
pimgNeighborAddress.description: The IP address of the PIM neighbor for which this entry contains information.

pimgNeighborIfIndex.name: pimgNeighborIfIndex
pimgNeighborIfIndex.description: The value of ifIndex for the interface used to reach this PIM neighbor.

pimgNeighborUpTime.name: pimgNeighborUpTime
pimgNeighborUpTime.description: The time since this PIM neighbor (last) became a neighbor of the local router.

pimgNeighborExpiryTime.name: pimgNeighborExpiryTime
pimgNeighborExpiryTime.description: The minimum time remaining before this PIM neighbor will be aged out.

pimgNeighborMode.name: pimgNeighborMode
pimgNeighborMode.description: The active PIM mode of this neighbor. This object is deprecated for PIMv2 routers since all neighbors on the interface must be either dense or sparse as determined by the protocol running on the interface.

pimgInetMRouteTable.name: pimgInetMRouteTable
pimgInetMRouteTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing PIM-specific information on a subset of the rows of the inetMRouteTable defined in the Inet Multicast MIB.

pimgInetMRouteEntry.name: pimgInetMRouteEntry
pimgInetMRouteEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimgInetMRouteTable. There is one entry per entry in the inetMRouteTable whose incoming interface is running PIM.

pimgInetMRouteUpstreamAssertTimer.name: pimgInetMRouteUpstreamAssertTimer
pimgInetMRouteUpstreamAssertTimer.description: The time remaining before the router changes its upstream neighbor back to its RPF neighbor. This timer is called the Assert timer in the PIM Sparse and Dense mode specification. A value of 0 indicates that no Assert has changed the upstream neighbor away from the RPF neighbor.

pimgInetMRouteAssertMetric.name: pimgInetMRouteAssertMetric
pimgInetMRouteAssertMetric.description: The metric advertised by the assert winner on the upstream interface, or 0 if no such assert is in received.

pimgInetMRouteAssertMetricPref.name: pimgInetMRouteAssertMetricPref
pimgInetMRouteAssertMetricPref.description: The preference advertised by the assert winner on the upstream interface, or 0 if no such assert is in effect.

pimgInetMRouteAssertRPTBit.name: pimgInetMRouteAssertRPTBit
pimgInetMRouteAssertRPTBit.description: The value of the RPT-bit advertised by the assert winner on the upstream interface, or false if no such assert is in effect.

pimgInetMRouteFlags.name: pimgInetMRouteFlags
pimgInetMRouteFlags.description: This object describes PIM-specific flags related to a multicast state entry. See the PIM Sparse Mode specification for the meaning of the RPT and SPT bits.

pimgInetMRouteNextHopTable.name: pimgInetMRouteNextHopTable
pimgInetMRouteNextHopTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing PIM-specific information on a subset of the rows of the inetMRouteNextHopTable defined in the IP Multicast MIB.

pimgInetMRouteNextHopEntry.name: pimgInetMRouteNextHopEntry
pimgInetMRouteNextHopEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimgInetMRouteNextHopTable. There is one entry per entry in the inetMRouteNextHopTable whose interface is running PIM and whose inetMRouteNextHopState is pruned(1).

pimgInetMRouteNextHopPruneReason.name: pimgInetMRouteNextHopPruneReason
pimgInetMRouteNextHopPruneReason.description: This object indicates why the downstream interface was pruned, whether in response to a PIM prune message or due to PIM Assert processing.

pimgRPTable.name: pimgRPTable
pimgRPTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing PIM version 1 information for the Rendezvous Points (RPs) for multicast groups. This table is deprecated since its function is replaced by the pimgRPSetTable for PIM version 2.

pimgRPEntry.name: pimgRPEntry
pimgRPEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimgRPTable. There is one entry per RP address for each multicast group.

pimgRPGroupAddressType.name: pimgRPGroupAddressType
pimgRPGroupAddressType.description: A value indicating the address family of the address contained in pimgRPGroupAddress. Legal values are: unknown(0), ipv4(1), ipv6(2), dns(16)

pimgRPGroupAddress.name: pimgRPGroupAddress
pimgRPGroupAddress.description: The multicast group address for which this entry contains information about an RP.

pimgRPAddressType.name: pimgRPAddressType
pimgRPAddressType.description: A value indicating the address family of the address contained in pimgRPAddress. The value MUST be the same as the value of pimgRPGroupAddressType.

pimgRPAddress.name: pimgRPAddress
pimgRPAddress.description: The unicast address of the RP.

pimgRPStateTimer.name: pimgRPStateTimer
pimgRPStateTimer.description: The minimum time remaining before the next state change. When pimgRPState is up, this is the minimum time which must expire until it can be declared down. When pimgRPState is down, this is the time until it will be declared up (in order to retry).

pimgRPLastChange.name: pimgRPLastChange
pimgRPLastChange.description: The value of sysUpTime at the time when the corresponding instance of pimgRPState last changed its value.

pimgRPRowStatus.name: pimgRPRowStatus
pimgRPRowStatus.description: The status of this row, by which new entries may be created, or old entries deleted from this table.

pimgRPSetTable.name: pimgRPSetTable
pimgRPSetTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing PIM information for candidate Rendezvous Points (RPs) for multicast groups. When the local router is the BSR, this information is obtained from received Candidate-RP- Advertisements. When the local router is not the BSR, this information is obtained from received RP- Set messages.

pimgRPSetEntry.name: pimgRPSetEntry
pimgRPSetEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimgRPSetTable.

pimgRPSetGroupAddressType.name: pimgRPSetGroupAddressType
pimgRPSetGroupAddressType.description: A value indicating the address family of the address contained in pimgRPSetGroupAddress. Legal values correspond to the subset of address families for which PIM routing is supported.

pimgRPSetGroupAddress.name: pimgRPSetGroupAddress
pimgRPSetGroupAddress.description: The IP multicast group address which, when combined with the value of pimgRPSetGroupMaskLen, gives the group prefix for which this entry contains information about the Candidate-RP.

pimgRPSetGroupMaskLen.name: pimgRPSetGroupMaskLen
pimgRPSetGroupMaskLen.description: The length in bits of the mask which, when combined with pimgRPSetGroupAddress, gives the group prefix for which this entry contains information about the Candidate-RP.

pimgRPSetAddressType.name: pimgRPSetAddressType
pimgRPSetAddressType.description: A value indicating the address family of the address contained in pimgRPSetAddress. The value MUST be the same as the value of pimgRPSetGroupAddressType.

pimgRPSetHoldTime.name: pimgRPSetHoldTime
pimgRPSetHoldTime.description: The holdtime of a Candidate-RP. If the local router is not the BSR, this value is 0.

pimgRPSetExpiryTime.name: pimgRPSetExpiryTime
pimgRPSetExpiryTime.description: The minimum time remaining before the Candidate-RP will be declared down. If the local router is not the BSR, this value is 0.

pimgRPSetComponent.name: pimgRPSetComponent
pimgRPSetComponent.description: A number uniquely identifying the component. Each protocol instance connected to a separate domain should have a different index value.

pimgCandidateRPTable.name: pimgCandidateRPTable
pimgCandidateRPTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the multicast groups for which the local router is to advertise itself as a Candidate-RP when the value of pimgComponentCRPHoldTime is non-zero. If this table is empty, then the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP for all groups (providing the value of pimgComponentCRPHoldTime is non-zero).

pimgCandidateRPEntry.name: pimgCandidateRPEntry
pimgCandidateRPEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimgCandidateRPTable.

pimgCandidateRPGroupAddressType.name: pimgCandidateRPGroupAddressType
pimgCandidateRPGroupAddressType.description: A value indicating the address family of the address contained in pimgCandidateRPGroupAddress. Legal values correspond to the subset of address families for which PIM routing is supported.

pimgCandidateRPGroupAddress.name: pimgCandidateRPGroupAddress
pimgCandidateRPGroupAddress.description: The multicast group address which, when combined with the corresponding value of pimgCandidateRPGroupMaskLen, identifies a group prefix for which the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

pimgCandidateRPGroupMaskLen.name: pimgCandidateRPGroupMaskLen
pimgCandidateRPGroupMaskLen.description: The length in bits of the mask which, when combined with pimgCandidateRPGroupAddress, identifies a group prefix for which the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

pimgCandidateRPAddressType.name: pimgCandidateRPAddressType
pimgCandidateRPAddressType.description: A value indicating the address family of the address contained in pimgCandidateRPAddress. The value MUST be the same as the value of pimgCandidateRPGroupAddressType.

pimgCandidateRPAddress.name: pimgCandidateRPAddress
pimgCandidateRPAddress.description: The (unicast) address of the interface which will be advertised as a Candidate-RP.

pimgCandidateRPRowStatus.name: pimgCandidateRPRowStatus
pimgCandidateRPRowStatus.description: The status of this row, by which new entries may be created, or old entries deleted from this table.

pimgComponentTable.name: pimgComponentTable
pimgComponentTable.description: The (conceptual) table containing objects specific to a PIM domain. One row exists for each domain to which the router is connected. A PIM-SM domain is defined as an area of the network over which Bootstrap messages are forwarded. Typically, a PIM- SM router will be a member of exactly one domain. This table also supports, however, routers which may form a border between two PIM-SM domains and do not forward Bootstrap messages between them.

pimgComponentEntry.name: pimgComponentEntry
pimgComponentEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the pimgComponentTable.

pimgComponentIndex.name: pimgComponentIndex
pimgComponentIndex.description: A number uniquely identifying the component. Each protocol instance connected to a separate domain should have a different index value. Routers that only support membership in a single PIM-SM domain should use a pimgComponentIndex value of 1.

pimgComponentBSRAddressType.name: pimgComponentBSRAddressType
pimgComponentBSRAddressType.description: A value indicating the address family of the address contained in pimgComponentBSRAddress. Legal values correspond to the subset of address families for which PIM routing is supported.

pimgComponentBSRAddress.name: pimgComponentBSRAddress
pimgComponentBSRAddress.description: The address of the bootstrap router (BSR) for the local PIM region.

pimgComponentBSRExpiryTime.name: pimgComponentBSRExpiryTime
pimgComponentBSRExpiryTime.description: The minimum time remaining before the bootstrap router in the local domain will be declared down. For candidate BSRs, this is the time until the component sends an RP-Set message. For other routers, this is the time until it may accept an RP-Set message from a lower candidate BSR.

pimgComponentCRPHoldTime.name: pimgComponentCRPHoldTime
pimgComponentCRPHoldTime.description: The holdtime of the component when it is a candidate RP in the local domain. The value of 0 is used to indicate that the local system is not a Candidate-RP.

pimgComponentStatus.name: pimgComponentStatus
pimgComponentStatus.description: The status of this entry. Creating the entry creates another protocol instance; destroying the entry disables a protocol instance.

pimgNeighborLoss.name: pimgNeighborLoss
pimgNeighborLoss.description: A pimgNeighborLoss trap signifies the loss of an adjacency with a neighbor. This trap should be generated when the neighbor timer expires, and the router has no other neighbors on the same interface with a lower IP address than itself.

pimgV1MIBCompliance.name: pimgV1MIBCompliance
pimgV1MIBCompliance.description: The compliance statement for routers running PIMv1 and implementing the PIM MIB.

pimgSparseV2MIBCompliance.name: pimgSparseV2MIBCompliance
pimgSparseV2MIBCompliance.description: The compliance statement for routers running PIM Sparse Mode and implementing the PIM MIB.

pimgDenseV2MIBCompliance.name: pimgDenseV2MIBCompliance
pimgDenseV2MIBCompliance.description: The compliance statement for routers running PIM Dense Mode and implementing the PIM MIB.

pimgNotificationGroup.name: pimgNotificationGroup
pimgNotificationGroup.description: A collection of notifications for signaling important PIM events.

pimgV2MIBGroup.name: pimgV2MIBGroup
pimgV2MIBGroup.description: A collection of objects to support management of PIM Sparse Mode (version 2) routers.

pimgDenseV2MIBGroup.name: pimgDenseV2MIBGroup
pimgDenseV2MIBGroup.description: A collection of objects to support management of PIM Dense Mode (version 2) routers.

pimgV2CandidateRPMIBGroup.name: pimgV2CandidateRPMIBGroup
pimgV2CandidateRPMIBGroup.description: A collection of objects to support configuration of which groups a router is to advertise itself as a Candidate-RP.

pimgV1MIBGroup.name: pimgV1MIBGroup
pimgV1MIBGroup.description: A collection of objects to support management of PIM (version 1) routers.

pimgNextHopGroup.name: pimgNextHopGroup
pimgNextHopGroup.description: A collection of optional objects to provide per- next hop information for diagnostic purposes. Supporting this group may add a large number of instances to a tree walk, but the information in this group can be extremely useful in tracking down multicast connectivity problems.

pimgAssertGroup.name: pimgAssertGroup
pimgAssertGroup.description: A collection of optional objects to provide extra information about the assert election process. There is no protocol reason to keep such information, but some implementations may already keep this information and make it available. These objects can also be very useful in debugging connectivity or duplicate packet problems, especially if the assert winner does not support the PIM and Inet Multicast MIBs.
